headline: Kofta Kebabs
description: Tasty grilled kofta kebabs made with ground lamb and 6 different kinds of spices: coriander, cumin, cinnamon, allspice, cayenne pepper, and ginger.

video.description: Ground lamb is marinated in spices and grilled on skewers.
video.name: Kofta Kebabs

name: Kofta Kebabs
recipeIngredient: 28 bamboo skewers, soaked in water for 30 minutes

recipeInstructions.text: Mash garlic into a paste with salt using a mortar and pestle or the flat side of a chef's knife on your cutting board.
Mix garlic into lamb with onion, parsley, coriander, cumin, cinnamon, allspice, cayenne pepper, ginger, and pepper in a mixing bowl until well blended.

Form mixture into 28 balls. Form each ball around the tip of a skewer, flattening it into a 2-inch oval; repeat with remaining skewers. Place kebabs onto a baking sheet, cover, and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes, or up to 12 hours.
Preheat an outdoor grill for medium heat and lightly oil the grate.

Cook skewers on the preheated grill, turning occasionally, until browned and cooked through, about 5 to 6 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center of a kebab should read at least 145 degrees F (63 degrees C).

review.reviewBody: Made this recipe ground beef and I loved it!

We love this recipe. We make it at least once a month. It’s perfect with pita, hummus, tzatziki, sliced tomatoes and red onions. Do let the meat and spices meld for a couple hours for best results. I’ve only made them with ground them and followed the recipe for all measurements. When trying to make it quick we just make them into balls and bake them. They turn out delicious that way too.
I found this recipe to be edible but very bland. I used the full amount of spices, and they were all fresh.

This was pretty close to Shawarma King on Beacon St in Brookline. Which is saying a lot. I didn't have time to make the paste so I just dumped the minced garlic and salt into the meat mixture and mashed it all together. Made a tahini and yogurt sauce to dress it with and made wraps with pita bread. I was also too much in a hurry - because rugby was coming on - to choo fresh parsley so I used dried parsley from the Indian market down the street. Nevertheless, this was absolutely delicious and I whipped the whole meal up in like 20 minutes... and ate almost the entire pound of ground beef mixture by myself in one sitting.

This recipe was delicious! I did cut back the cinnamon to 1 tsp. Instead of grilling I broiled them just as small 2" patties for 5-6 minutes on top of a broiler pan Excellent with tzaziki and warmed naan bread!
Great recipe! Turned out better than I’ve ever ordered and so simple! My guests were impressed!!!
I overcooked the first batch I made but the flavor was still amazing. I’ve never cooked lamb before and this was really straightforward.

This was delicious...ALMOST like a favorite local Lebanese restaurant. I used 1 TB of Kafta Seasoning instead of this seasoning. Fresh parsley and grated onion was important. Shaped them long and used mix of ground chicken and beef. They did shrink a bit, so make them longer if using on a bun or something.

Made this recipe multiple times. I’ve made it all beef and all lamb and find them both really tasty! I don’t use nearly as much cinnamon! I do go heavier on onion tho. Easy to make, I serve it with fresh chopped onion, lettuce, tomato, pita bread a sour cream.

Delicious! I have made a few different versions of Kofta and this is the best by far. Even my Jordanian aunt would approve, I’m sure. I also made the garlic sauce recommended by another reviewer and it provided the perfect finishing touch.
Fantastic melded flavors. I used Ground turkey- still delicious !

Excellent recipe, great balance on the spices. I did make two small changes.
1. Used 1 lb of veal instead of lamb, because that's what we had in the freezer
2. Divided meat into 12 pieces and doubled them up on the skewers (so, used 6 skewers)
Served with homemade flatbread, and it was an amazing meal.
Absolutely delicious!! I wouldn’t change a thing about this recipe. I used ground beef this time and will try ground turkey next time.
This is delicious! So easy to make and dynamite flavor. My GF thanks you a thousand times!

This has become a favorite in my household. I have travelled a lot internationally, and this is the closest recipe that I’ve seen to when I was in India. It is NOT nearly as spicy as what I have had in India but still the quality is good. I frequently shape this into patties and it can even be eaten as a burger. 

At some point, I will try with crushed Coriander instead of powdered.
Great for appetizers, but, since we had some hot dog buns left, we made in the form of sausages, and topped with Tzatsiki sauce.
wonderful recipe. I spent a month touring Turkey a few years ago and fell in love with the food. took me right back there.

I made this on my grill last night and they turned out awesome! I was only able to get about 20 skewers because I guess I put a little more on each than the original recipe poster. When I started dropping the spices in the pound of lamb it was looking like too much, but it really turned out great! Everyone that came over loved them and they disappeared quickly. Next time I'll double the recipe just to make sure I have plenty for everyone!

Overall, fairly good but way to much coriander for me. I am someone who loves cilantro but for the first time in my life I understood when people say they taste soap when they eat it (coriander is the seed of cilantro). If I didn't taste "soap" upon eating this I think I would have really enjoyed it. That's the only reason I didn't give it a higher star rating. Served it with saffron rice and a quick tomato cucumber salad.

This is a keeper. Absolutely delicious. Used exact ingredients as stated. 
We had 3 long flat metal skewers and placed about 6 to 7 round balls on each and shaped them like a log. Grilled and served with salad & homemade tzatziki sauce! Wouldnt change a thing!

Fantastic recipe! I made mine with the ground lamb and wrapped 2oz around skewers formed to fit in pita bread that was spread with hummus. Grilled on the barbecue. Best kofta I have ever had. I’ll make it at home from now on!!!

My son and I made this recipe and everyone loved it. The only change was using 1/2 lamb and 1/2 very lean beef. The spices give it such depth! We paired it with koshari and 3 ingredient salad. Loved it. Will make again!
Awesome recipe! I used ground beef instead of lamb. The kids gobbled them up!

We use hamburger because we don't have access to ground lamb, plus lambs are just so dang cute, but this is part of our regular rotation. I actually use the garam masala recipe from this app and adjust the amount to match the amount of spices listed here. I make a large quantity so this ends up being really easy to prep. I always make tzatziki and have hummus and pita or naan bread with this. Roasted tomatoes with feta cheese and oregano also make a great side with these

Yum! These were delicious. The kids all enjoyed it- Their first time having lamb! -well, two demanded ketchup. I made mini burgers because I had no sticks. I served with fried sweet potato slices for “buns.”
Fast, simpke excellent.

I used to date a guy from Lebanon. He would make this as a special treat to me and I never got recipe before he went back. All I remembered was the cinnamon... I tried this and I’m so happy! This may be even better than his! Served with olive oil couscous and watched it disappear!!
It was very good, but I had to add a little bit more spices and salt. That could be just for my taste but over all very very good
I did not make any changes. The original recipe is already amazing. Really love it. Thanks. I learn something new as well.

Made these last night with 93/7 ground beef (WW friendly) and I cut the cinnamon down to half a TEASPOON... cooked the little footballs on a oiled grill pan and I didn’t skewer them(very informal). They were super juicy and delicious!!

Great recipe. I made a few minor changes based on personal preference and what I remember the street vendors in India doing. So I use a blend of ground beef (as done by Indian street chefs) and chorizo (about a 2:1 blend). I also chop up some green bell pepper to go with the onions and add a teaspoon of clove powder for that slow heat. Finally, lacking easy access to a grill at my apartment, I cook these in my oven at 350 degrees for about 15 minutes and that works just great.
Omg we loved it!!! We used ground turkey though. My husband said “what meat did you use?” When i said just ground turkey, he was shocked. He said it was the best turkey he’d ever had.
Excellent! Made these with beef... served with tzatziki.

I’m from Detroit also...and miss Greektown. I was more of a dolmatas/Greek salad/Opa! girl....but these tasted great. I served them with tomatoes, cucumbers and onions, pita bread and a zesty dill sauce I made (sour cream, fresh dill, lime juice) I also added some feta to mine...because...you know...FETA!! Not sure I’ll make this recipie again. 14 year old step-daughter wouldn’t touch it and my husband is more interested in watching TV and eating chips lol. I think my kids in their 20’s would like it.

loveeeeeeeeeeeeeee this....
love lamb
love middle eastern food
this was so good
I made it with turkey and omg it’s DELICIOUS. The amount of spices is just perfect. And the spice mix itself aaahhh it’s restaurant quality!!

Made these twice now. The spices really add wonderful savoury flavour. Goes great with tzatziki or any yogurt sauce. 
Tip: don’t turn the lamb too soon. It will move easily when it’s seared. If the kofta is sticking to the pan give it another minute.

Made as in recipe, came out perfect and very delicious. Made it for the party - they were gone in a minute.
Thank you!
I only had 1/2 tbls of fresh parsley so I used dried for the remaining 2 1/2 tbls. Worked great.

We doubled the amount using 1lb of ground lamb and 1lb of lean ground beef (93/7) and baked at 375F for 25min. Next time I will try a less lean ground beef to see if it will come out a bit less dry. Overall though it was an excellent recipe!

Perfect and easy. I used 1 lb of g. lamb and 1/2 lb of g. chuck. made into sausage shape and baked at 350 degrees for 25 min. Served on warmed pita bread with cukes, lettuce, sliced onion and cherry tomatoes. When I have raw onions on hamburgers or salads, I usually slice and soak in ice water for ten minutes. They aren't as strong that way. I also made the garlic sauce another post mentioned. I am making this for the second time.
The only change I made was adding chopped mint to the meat, for which I used half lamb and half beef. Excellent recipe, very tasty.
I put tabouli and used sour cream instead a yogurt in my pocket . OMG SO good and I use just ground lamb, That we raised

Since this was the first time making this, I did not change the recipe at all, and I wouldn't next time either. I served these as an appetizer and my guests RAVED about them. I will definitely make this again!
The first time I made this and my family loved it. My son gave it a 10. I made a Tzatziki sauce which is perfect with the Kofta.

These relatively easy to make and came out tasty. I did cut the amount of cinnamon in half and it was fine for the recipe. I also made the meat balls about triple the size recipe called for as I had bigger sticks I was working with. Still Cooked fine on the grill.
Used this recipe to make mini burgers (sliders)! Super juicy, topped with feta cheese and arugula!
Make these all the time and we LOVE them! Great as a leftover too!
So good! Made these with ground turkey and made into patties since I was a little pressed for time. So basically made turkey burgers with them. Even my picky eater loved them.
I used ground beef and served with tzatziki sauce.

These were amazing! I loved the spice combination. I doubled mine up on the skewers, since it seemed like a waste to only put one little meatball on each skewer, and stuck a mini sweet pepper in between them. We ate on pitas that we also grilled, with yogurt and cucumber. I wish lamb were cheaper so I could make these more often!
Delicious! Loved the aroma and taste of the spices.
I bought a lamb roast then filleted and ground the meat myself. I only had six skewers so my portions were big. I left the onions out due to personal preference but it turned out really well.

We've never eaten anything like this before and were unsure what to expect. I followed the recipe exactly except I baked them at 350 for about a half hr instead of grilling them. I only used 4 skewers and shaped the lamp mixture into 2 inch ovals and put 3 on each skewer. I served it with a Tzatziki sauce that I found on this site. Both hubby and I really enjoyed it. The flavors were so different than anything we normally eat and they were so good!
Superb
I made this for my daughter's in-laws. It was a bit risky since they are good cooks! But it came out great!

These turned out AMAZING! This recipe made 16 nice pingpong sized balls. For those of you who feel that there was too much cinnamon, try using ground cardamom instead. It still subtly gives it those warm, sweet notes but it adds real depth. I will definitely be making this again. Thanks for such a great recipe!
Substitutes well with beef if you can't find lamb. :)

We have an Egyptian restaurant that we go to for their Kofta kebabs and I really wanted to make them at home. This recipe was GREAT! The flavors were spot on - thanks for sharing this. Definitely would make again and share with friends.

Note that I made them on longer metal skewers and seared on high for 2 minutes each side and then 4 minutes each side after on medium, rotating continually to get an even cook. YUM!

This was really great. I don't think I would change anything about it, and we will definitely be having these fairly often.
I served in a pita with Tahini and Tabouli.
i use this basic recipe for a number of dishes.

Love this recipe, it's a go to for me when we are grilling Mediterranean style foods. Very authentic, sometimes I use lamb and sometimes we use lean beef, either way they have always turned out delicious.
Excellent. Even works well with a George Foreman grill! The spices were pretty powerful, but I like it that way

Delicious. An easy sauce to serve with it is, that I got from another reviewer is: 4 cloves of garlic, peeled and crushed, 1/4 c. olive oil, juice of 1 lemon, 1/4 t. salt. Blend in food processor/blender.
I think 1 tsp of corriander would be plenty based on other recipes I've found. 1 TBS was over seasoned.
We love this recipe! I make it following the recipe. I make about 20 meatball sized balls, and then shape them onto mini skewers. Baked at 350 for 25 min. We eat it with rice or couscous. Delicious!

This recipe is so delicious! I make it at least monthly usually doubling the recipe for leftovers. Typically I skip putting them on skewers and just grill them directly turning frequently. Occasionally I make larger patties and turn them into lamb burgers topped with grilled purple onions, tomatoes, tzaziki, and a small spread of hummus. Kofta night is always a hit!

I made this tonight for the first time. Will definitely be doing it again. I made the portions bigger though. I doubled the ingredients, and ended up with 18 skewers altogether. Crispy brown, barbecued in butter. I used tzatziki dip instead of yoghurt. Delicious!
Followed exactly. Seasonings tasted great. Instead of making that many small ones I got lazy and made 10 larger pieces to grill
Best use of ground lamb I've found. Delish!

Made with beef/pork mix. Used less cinnamon and subbed nutmeg for allspice, as that's all I had. Pan fried too. Served over rice (toasted garlic and pine nut). Topped with dressing recipe as provided in comments by reviewer named Chuck Wesserling. Simply delish! Hubby can't wait to eat the leftovers tomorrow ;)
These are delicious! I didn't put them on skewers, but rather made them into patty-like shapes and grilled them. So much flavor!!! I used ground beef bc we can't afford lamb :)

I used ground beef because I didn't have lamb on hand and these turned out AMAAAAAZING. My husband and I both loved this recipe and it was easy as pie to make and grill. We served it over basmati rice with homemade tzatziki sauce and it was just killer.

These were amazing! I made them according to the recipe, and they tutned out perfectly. I was surprised how juicy they were considering there was no binder like most meatballs. Will definitely make these more often!
I add cardamom and sumac

This is a fine recipe for Kofkas, but it doesn't serve 28 people . I re-read the recipe about six times, trying to figure out how one pound of lamb was going to feed that many people. This recipe is for maybe 4 people at most. It needs to come off the category, "cooking for a crowd" - because it'll leave a crowd hungry, if that's all that's available for a main course.

Amazing! I doubled the recipe and used half turkey and half beef because the grocery store was out of ground lamb. The spices gave the meat a wonderful flavor. I served this with homemade pita bread and a Greek salad. Will definitely make again.

I made these as directed, minus the cinnamon. I was pleased that they held up so well on the grill -- I was worried they would stick and fall apart. My only complaint would be that they were a little dry. They may have benefited from the addition of another ground meat, like veal or pork.

These are tasty, but no reason you can't make them with a lower fat meat, like lean ground beef. Served in pitas and lettuce wraps with lemon-tahini sauce and a cucumber, tomato, onion, mint blend with lemon juice, salt and pepper.

This was incredibly delicious. I made it as directed except I used ground turkey thigh. Because this meat can be dry I gently melted about 2 tablespoons butter in a small pot and used that as a base to mix all the seasonings.
They were good. Only downside is they were quit dry even though I followed the recipe perfectly. I suggest a side a tzatziki sauce for dipping

I'm Middle Eastern and grew up on these. This is a pretty good recipe. There is however a spice combo available at Middle Eastern markets called "7 Spice", which is as traditional as you can get, this recipe is missing a spice.
Excellent recipe! These came out amazing. I highly recommend. Followed the recipe exactly.

This combination of seasonings was delicious! I made my kebabs with onion and pepper, grilled in an iron skillet, and served on top of some basmati rice. I cooked the skewers for 6 minutes each, 3 minutes per side, for a beautiful medium. I did use cubed lamb chop, instead of ground lamb because I prefer steak to ground meat. I simply put all of the seasonings into a bowl and coated the lamb with it. I did need to use a little bit of olive oil to make it all stick and give the lamb a nice crust of the seasonings. It was absolutely delicious!

This is an excellent recipe but I think next time I will cut the cinnamon back just a little. Otherwise, I made it as written for the first time and served it with tzatziki sauce. I forgot to buy pita bread. That would have been perfection then! We will have these again at our house. Love lamb and it sure is fun to find creative ways to use it. Thanks for a wonderful recipe.
Excellent flavor, we cooked them on the BBQ. Also made a yoghurt dip with grated cucumber and crushed garlic. Yum!
I used ground beef instead, very good taste. This is a keeper. Thank you for sharing.

I love this recipe. The first time I made it I didn't have any lamb so used ground beef as others had done. I followed everything else as per the recipe. For cooking I place 4 of the kebab balls to one large metal skewer. Used ask many skewers as required based on how many servings I required.. This made rotating them during cooking very simple while being able to cook many in one sitting. While the ground beef turned out well the next two times I made them I used lamb and they were awesome. Everyone in the family loves them and will continue to make as per this recipe.

This was delicious! I mixed all of the ingredients together in a bowl then cooked it in a skillet like ground beef. I served it over rice with diced cucumber and fresh tomatoes with Greek plain yogurt.

This was delicious! I mixed all of the ingredients together in a bowl then cooked it in a skillet like ground beef. I served it over rice with diced cucumber and fresh tomatoes with Greek plain yogurt.

Delicious! I had about 1/2 lb lamb so I scaled it to 14 servings. I loved the spicy flavor with a nice kick (no coriander on hand). I don't have access to a grill, so I rolled them into 18 small meatballs. I placed them on a foil-lined sheet and baked @ 350 deg F for 25 min. (I had plans to broil a bit, but they browned up nicely just baking them.) I made a little of the garlic sauce mentioned by the top reviewer, and it was excellent with these! I get the gamey taste of lamb, so I'm going to try with beef, as others have mentioned, the next time. Great recipe - thanks!

Prepared exactly as directed except I used an indoor grill. These were fantastic! Easy and quick to make, flavorful and healthy too. Served with a cauliflower lentil curry and the meatballs were a perfect accompaniment.
The spice combination is really authentic! I make it without the skewers and the lamb doesn't fall apart. Great with side of tabbouli, cous cous, and some mint yogurt.

My husband and I recently started eating a healthier low carb, higher protein diet. After several weeks, our taste buds were beginning to get bored, so I decided to try a savory protein based dish.

This was delicious and hubby hasn't stopped raving about tonight's wonderful dinner.

I omitted the cayenne pepper since we both suffer from acid reflux and super spicy foods aggravate the condition.

Will definitely be making this again soon!
Tastes pretty authentic. Very delicious!
Used ground beef because my dislikes lamb and it was delicious. Made the sauce and serve over jasmine rice.

I love lebanese food but my husband always said that he did not care for ethnic foods. I made this recipe into meat balls but did not tell him that it was a lebanese recipe until he said that he really love these meat balls. The kicker is that he wants me to make them again
I have made these a handful of times and everyone always loves them. They are very flavorful!
Everyone loved this when I made it. The flavors are wonderful. I made this with lamb and with buffalo. The buffalo was too lean to hold its shape.
